keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: An annual study of young people’s smoking habits gives us reasons for optimism, not alarm.
snippet: An annual study of young people’s smoking habits gives us reasons for optimism, not alarm.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column asserts Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's 2015 National Youth Tobacco Survey, in reporting tripling of e-cigarette use among teens over one year, masks more significant news that combustible cigarette use has dropped to 9.2 percent; holds decline is most likely due to rise in e-cigarettes, which are far less damaging to one's health; says report, in equating combustible and e-cigarette use, does disservice to public health.
